Package com.example.happymeals.recipe

Class Recipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.happymeals.database.DatabaseObject
      • com.example.happymeals.recipe.Recipe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Recipe
extends DatabaseObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    The parent object for this class which allows it to be stored inside the firebase databse using the This class represents recipes that can be loaded inside the application and shown to the end user., Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Recipe

        public Recipe()
        Empty Constructor, this is required for FireStoreManager

      • Recipe

        public Recipe​(java.lang.String name,
              double cookTime,
              java.lang.String description,
              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> comments,
              java.util.ArrayList<Ingredient> ingredients,
              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> instructions,
              double prepTime,
              double servings)
        Full constructor to create a recipe will all the provided attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - The String representing the name of the recipe
        cookTime - The Double representing the time it takes to cook the meal in hrs.
        description - The String field which will hold the description of the recipe.
        comments - The ArrayList which holds an array of Strings which hold comments the users might have added to the recipe.
        ingredients - The ArrayList which holds all the ingredient used in the recipe.
        instructions - ArrayList holding all the instructions in order to complete the recipe. These are all String values.
        prepTime - Double the time to prep the recipe measured in hrs.
        servings - Double The servings that the meal makes with the ingredients described.

    • Method Detail

      • getCookTime

        public double getCookTime()
        Gets the cook time of the recipe.
        Returns:
        Double cookTime measured in hrs.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets the description of the recipe.
        Returns:
        String object used to store the description.

      • getComments

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getComments()
        Gets the comments of the recipe.
        Returns:
        ArrayList object used to store the comments.

      • getCommentsAsString

        public java.lang.String getCommentsAsString()
        Goes through all the comment strings and forms them into a single string. This is intended to be used by activities such that the comments can be placed as a string.
        Returns:
        String of all the combined comments from comments ArrayList.

      • getIngredients

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ingredient> getIngredients()
        Gets the list of ingredients needed to make the meal with the described servings.
        Returns:
        ArrayList holding all the ingredients.

      • getInstructions

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getInstructions()
        Gets the list of instructions which are stored in the order of which they need to be completed.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList holding all the String values representing the instructions to make the meal.

      • getInstructionsAsString

        public java.lang.String getInstructionsAsString()
        Goes through all the instruction strings and forms them into a single string. This is intended to be used by activities such that the instructions can be placed as a string.
        Returns:
        String of all the combined comments from instructions ArrayList.

      • getPrepTime

        public double getPrepTime()
        Gets the stored prep time of the recipe. This is the total time - cook time.
        Returns:
        THe Double representing the prepTime in hrs.

      • getServings

        public double getServings()
        Gets the servings which the recipe will make with the given amount of each ingredient.
        Returns:
        Double of the servings, can be fractional.
